review_blob: Bottle from holiday pack. Good color, amber, decent head, nice tosty caramle aroma. I didnt taste much in the way of spice but it had a pleasant old world appeal and flavor, some dark malt, touch smoky; something of a light strong ale. Nice holiday brew. I rather enjoyed this beer.

Bottle. Really nice appearance with a nice, dark tan head. Roasty aroma is sweet and inviting. Smooth tasting, semi sweet with plenty of roastiness and coffee flavors. Nice creamy body, sort of silky. Good brew.
Bottle. Great aroma, vinuous, malty, caramel, bubblegum, spice. A bit harsh rough around the edges when cold, strong flavor, alcohol, caramel and toasted malt. Very good overall.

Bottle 2007. Another fine creation from Legend. Pours a thick, jet black beer that resembles molasses, average sized brownish mahogany head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, anise, coffee, toffee, caramel chocolate. A touch acrid at first but mellows out after a few sips. Flavor is very complex, very malty and very good. Some spiciness comes through. Full bodied, silky, smooth and perfectly carbonated. They make some fine brews.

Bottle. Pours a crystal, golden color which clouds as the settled yeast is poured. Huge, billowy head. A fruity light aroma with hints of grape. A slight medicinal aroma is present. Flavor was good, strong, yeasty, fruity. Medium bodied and mildly refreshing, this was a solid beer which put me to sleep quickly. I think Thanksgiving dinner had a lot to do with it.

Bottle. Poured a clear, sparkling golden color with a large white head. Aroma of yeast and sourness. Possibly infected this beer had a tartness that wasnt in itself bad, but detracted from an already bland flavor. Very mediocre.

Bottle. Reddish hued amber. Very effervescent. Sour fruity aroma, vinegar, cellar scents, floral. Tangy, sour, slightly acidic. Alcohol, breaad, super diverse flavor. Pilsner beer flavor, almost macro tasting flavor sneaks through in the finish.

Bottle. Dark amber. Huge head, cant even pour whole bottle no matter how slowly. Initial aroma is pure banana. Dark malt and then grape and yeasty aromas come through but banana dominates. Some tartness. Extremely high carbonation, acidic bite...not very pleasant. Taste is sour with light malt flavors and hints of syrupy fruits. Does not improve much. Not impressed.
Bottle. Dry aroma. Light body. Grainy macro lager flavor. Slight hint of caramel malt. crap.

Bottle 0479 of 2007. Pours a dark amber, opaque ale with a very thin, almost non-existent head. Very rich, robust aroma of malt, caramel, coffee; hints of citrus fruit but little hop aroma. Strong malt flavor, hops (bitterness) more pronounced in flavor than aroma. Strong ale? Moreso than a "unique barleywine" as described on label. Full bodied. Decent alcohol strength and very satisfying. Overall pretty damn good.
beer_name: AleWerks Brewmasters Reserve Wolfes Trap Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Brilliant, dark amber color, high carbonation forms a big head, malty caramel dubbel aroma, not much yeast aroma, touch of roast. Very robust flavor, a touch astringent, semi dry and semi bitter in finish. No hops detected. Full bodied, fairly clear, very little trub. Well done.

Bottle. Medium amber/orange color, small white head, many small particulates, floaters. Hoppy aroma with hints of light toasted malt. Light to medium bodied. Had an initial oxidized flavor, light ginger taste in background. Some spiciness and hops flavor.  I would say this is just average but the originality earned it a point or two. Might be better fresh and served with sushi.

11.2 oz bottle. Huge billowy, frothy off white head...lingers, laces. Sticky looking foam stays in center like ancient ruins while larger bubbles dissipate along outer edges. Murky, cloudy golden orange with floaters. Aroma of malt, sugar. Typical belgian tripel smell. Some fruit, yeast, apricot, some citrus hop aroma. Malty tripel flavor, semi bitter, some mild alcohol flavor present, hints of citrus, ever so faint grassy notes. Not overly sweet or dry. Well balanced and unique but the hops only stand out slightly more than average tripels. Slight astringency fades with carbonation. Very solid.

Bottle. Black, med/large tan colored head. Dissipated pretty quick. Aroma of roast, vanilla bean, coffee. Bitter coffee flavor, not very sweet. Some vanilla hints and roastiness. Fairly drier than expected. Good.

Bottle. Very light straw, large head. Fruity, wheat arooma with yeast notes. Highly carbonated. Wheat flavor marred by a graininess and mild astringency. Some tartness, some very light spice notes. Improved as it warmed, but it lacked the softness of better belgian witbiers. Overall not too bad.

Bottle. My firstmead rating. Poured a pale golden color, wine like in texture, semi syrupy. Looks like a white wine. Fruity aroma, no detectable alcohol aroma. Very sweet, and somewhat vinuous, a pleasant honey flavor. Subtle fruit nots and a cough syrupy quality slightly detracts from overall flavor. I enjoyed this. Not much to base it on, but it was good.

Bottle. Light in color, body and head. Aroma unique, some hay, grain. Malty, uncoventioanl caramel sweetness, soft caky flavor with touchs of fruit, grapes I guess. I thought this was interesting and deserves a point or two for originality.

Bottle. Super light yellow/straw color, good sized white head, small lacing. Aroma is of grainy, malty effervescence. Sharp lager like smell. Smooth flavor, not as stinging as some pilseners, but adequately crisp and dry. Very drinkable. In the grand scheme, its just decent, but for lighter lager types, this was good drinking beer.

Bottle. Dark brown/black color, big, brown sticky head, lasts and laces. Aroma is of coffee, chocolate just a touch of roast. Flavor is robustly amlt heavy, chocolate (surprise), coffee, with a bit of nuttiness. Very smooth drinking, roast isnt overdone and not acrid or acidic at all. Keeping in line with their decent lineup, this is one solid brew. Very smooth drinking sipper.

Bottle. Pours a typical pale golden color, small white head. Aroma is decent but average, light malt, beer smell. Flavor is dissappointing. Bland pale ale flavor with a macro character. Grape flavor doesnt become evident til end of glass. Semi dry. Maybe something was lost in the transition from homebrew to mass production. Drinkable but boring.
beer_name: Samuel Adams LongShot Grape Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Cap Ale House. Dark, amber, large bubbles around a large tan head. Very vinuoous aroma, malt, plum, alcohol, carmelized sugars. Flavor has some spice notes, bitterness, accompanied by what comes off as hot alc tastes, but is actually due to being served too cold and tthe beer being overcarbed for my personal preference. Just too much bite. As it warms, it of course improves as fruity, wheat notes come alive. Should have drank this slower. Adequetely strong tasting, this beer needs to mellow before drinking.

Draught at Cap Ale. Rich ruby amber color, medium off white head. Smoky, caramel aroma, typical scottish ale smells. Dark malt flavor, caramelized, bittter, a bit one dimensional. Somewhat of a slight lagerlike character. A bit dissappointing.

Dark amber, medium sized head. Hoopy citrus aroma, hints of pine, vanilla, malt. Fresh C-hop flavor up front, very citrusy, alcohol flavor. Some malt flavor manages to peak through, but just barely. Some fruity and floral qualities toward end of glass. Very good.
beer_name: Flying Dog Double Dog Double Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Clear, light colored, huge white head. Lighter than expected color. Yeast, grain like aroma. Flavor is okay,  improves with time; wheat notes softening up but is just average. Basically a decent hefeweizen.

Bottle. Amber color, thinner than expected head. A very malty profile that is balanced well. Dark caramelized sugar, fruity notes, alcohol strength evident. Good barleywine, but may be lacking a certain complexity.

Bottle. A classic hefeweizen this pours an immediately cloudy, pale straw colored beer with a puffy white head. Good aroma of bananas with a light yeast aroma and some bubblegum notes. Light citrusy flavor, yeast highlights the soft wheat malt character and bubblegum under notes. Light to medium bodied with good light carbonation. This would be awesome fresh.

Bottle. Clear, golden color with a thin head. Light, fruity aroma. Really simple yet good flavor. With a strong malt backbone, and a dry, clean finish, this beer is semi herbal or floral, has light notes of apricot, touch of grape. Very refreshing, I dont know why such low scores. I thought this was well done and original. The history alone deserves a point or two.
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2008

Bottle. Pours a red coloer with a small, pink/lavender head, actually some thin lacing. Aroma is of cough syrup, bluberry syrup, grainy lager aroma. Flavor is not good initially, but then it doenst get any better. Yucky syrupy, astringent blueberry, followed by a crappy vienna lager taste complete with husky tastes. The only strength is its strength, its 8% ABV is its only redeeming quality.

Bottle. Pours a very dark amber with a full off white head. Great appearance. Beautiful aroma of bubblegum, almonds, with a touch of banana and a slight roasted note. Flavor is toasted bread, caramel with some roast and nutty flavors. A very slight off taste detected-maybe to caramelized or roasty. Med to full bodied, a very good beer overall.
Bottle. Golden color, semi hazy, full white head. Yeasty light malt aroma. Smooth flavor, characteristic belgian yeast flavor, pilsner malt taste, sweetness. Not much bitterness. Very good.
Bottle. Grassy, hop aroma. Flavor is hoppy, citrus, grass, mild malt profile. Fairly well balanced and dry. Medium body. Good beer. Easy to drink.

Bottle. Pours a clear pale straw color, smallish head. Very thin palate. Aroma is weak, grainy, sweet, lemon and honey. Very light and easy drinking, flavor is light malt and honey, citrus. Touch of wheat flavor. Refreshing summer ale but lacking character.
beer_name: Blue Moon Honey Moon Summer Ale

review_blob: Bottle. Dull gold color, big giant head with large bubbles. Aroma is excellent. A sweet aroma of malt, honey, bread, yeast, some sourness. Flavor starts off with an unpleasant astringency. Yeast some light grape flavors. Flavor improves as it warms of course, but never meets what was expected from aroma. Body is medium, but I found this to be over carbed. Overall not the best tripel.

Draught at Morocan restaurant in Karlsruhe. Typical looking hefe, cloudy straw/orange color, avg head. Aroma of banana, yeast, wheat, gum, spice. Similar flavor profile. Refreshing and drinkable. This was a good hefeweizen, but not the best. I had it fresh. Good memories, decent beer.

Bottle. Dark color, nearly black but clear. Large billowy, brown head. Complex malty aroma, semi grainy, some alcohol, touch of chocolate and soap? A rich yet clean flavor profile. Resembles a schwarzbier for me. Kind of lager like, but very complex. Lighter than expected body. Low carbonatin. Good.
UPDATED: MAR 22, 2008

Bottle. Light, straw colored, with a light haze, huge head. Aroma is very complex, sweet, malt touch of spice. Flavor is also fairly complex, malty, light fruitiness with hints of honey and spice. Touch of yeastiness. Smooth and silky, refreshing.

Bottle. Dark brown color, opaque, medium head. Caramel or toffee aroma with hints of chocolate and roast. Full flavored. Bready, toasty, some roast and a nuttiness. A touch too sticky sweet. Full bodied. Very good.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Bottle. Drank from the bottle. Aroma of caramel malt. Caramel flavor followed by a distinct hop taste, touch of spice. Decent.

Draught at Bottoms Up. Cloudy yellow color. Citrus and yeasty aroma. Semi tart flavor with citrus and a hearty wheat flavor and belgian wit yeast flavor. Slightly bitter and wheat not as soft as usual. Hop flavor more pronounced in finish than most wheats. Decent but lacking refinement.

Bottle. Pours a surprisingly light but rich looking copper, amber. Hardly any head. Sweet, spicy aroma, like a malty barleywine w/ alcohol aromas. Flavor is full, heavy malt with alcohol and some citrusy hops. Bordering on harsh. Med to full bodied. Manages to be fairly dry.
Bottle. Aroma is of caramel, semi grainy, hint of alcohol. Rich caramelized flavor; soft lager like crispness, full bodied, may be lacking a bit of complexity, fairly  smooth.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2008

Bottle. Dark amber, surprisingly small head. Aroma was fairly rich, dark fruit malt, alcohol. A malty sweet and equally rich flavor, heavy caramel. Has an un-hidden alcohol taste. Flavor similar to well made authentic Belgian counterparts but falls short in complexity compared to some of these other examples. Very good malty flavor and adequate strength.

Bottle. Dark, black color, brown edges and small, brown head. Aroma is very malty, roasty with alcohol and hints of coffee. Touch of soy sauce aroma. Flavor is spicy and malty with chocolate nad coffee, touches of anise, oak and vanilla.

Bottle. Dark porter color, small head. Aroma is malty, vanilla, touch of anise. Flavor is nice, roasted malt, sweet with vanilla and no hop flavor at all, hint of coffee and toffee, slight bite in middle. Sweet finish. Good specialty or dessert beer.
Bottle. Golden amber color, average head. Average beer aroma. Flavor is very smooth, a good barley and wheat taste and nice hop flavor. Touch of lemon. Just plain and simple, a pleasant beer.

Bottle 2007-12.5%. Orange hued amber color, small head. Fruity, pungent aroma with hints of spice and alcohol and hops. Full bodied, the alcohol taste is prevalent and strong. Fruity flavor up front, follwed by a well balanced hop flavor, but alcohol dominates, maybe slightly too much. Nevertheless, a good sipping drink.

Bottle. Clear pours eventually gets sekmi hazy. Big bubbled head. Fruity aroma has touches of cough syrup, apricot. Flavor is hard to pin down. Candi, popcorn, slightly grainy. A bit astringent and a wierd but somehow pleasant alcohol flavor and aroma. A bit too bitter. Unique but not special.
